measured_by: drift rate (v) parameter of the Drift Diffusion Model
justification: "Drift rate (v) reflects the rate of evidence accumulation, where stronger drift rate leads to faster and more accurate decisions."

measured_by: decision threshold (a) parameter of the Drift Diffusion Model
justification: "Decision threshold (a) captures the speed-accuracy tradeoff, where wider decision thresholds require more evidence to be accumulated to reach a decision."

measured_by: starting point bias (z) parameter of the Drift Diffusion Model
justification: "The starting point bias parameter (z) captures the starting point of the accumulation process."

topic_or_construct: Time spent on stimulus encoding and motor response
measured_by: non-decision time (ndt) parameter of the Drift Diffusion Model
justification: "Non-decision time (ndt) captures the time spent on encoding the stimulus and motor response."
The authors describe the N-back as "a decision-making task probing working memory capacity," and analyze accuracy and response time from this task.

measured_by: first principal component of the NIH Toolbox cognitive battery
justification: "We performed principal component analysis on uncorrected scores from all 7 tasks and included the first component in analyses as a measure of general cognitive ability."
